ygData.subject: RE: Stein Quest
ygData.msgSnippet: Every time I did it I gave all the ingredients to him at once. As a high elf, I never had a problem with the ogre, who actually cons better to me than the
ygData.messageBody:
Every time I did it I gave all the ingredients to him at once. As a high
elf, I never had a problem with the ogre, who actually cons better to me
than the barkeep does. Aren't factions screwy things?

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jenni [SMTP:freya@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, November 30, 1999 1:54 PM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Stein Quest
>
> From: Jenni <freya@...>
>
> I can't say what will happen if I give him all the ingredients at once
> because
> both times I did it separately and it worked fine.
>
> I never tried the alliance spell when the Ogre was in there, he killed me
> twice. :( I did notice however the ogre leaves at night (game time) and a
> dark
> elf and a dwarf show up in his place. They were indifferent to me, so I
> completed that part of the quest when they were in there.
>
> Ezrae
>
>
> Rich Hitz wrote:
>
> > From: Rich Hitz <Rich.Hitz@...>
> >
> > <snip>
> > I forgot to mention that the web page doesn't mention that 2 of the
> > components (the Koalindl fish and the Eruds Tonic) required to complete
> the
> > first half of the quest (make the bartenders compendum) are no drop, as
> is
> > the compendum.
> > <snip>
> >
> > A fellow guild member also told me to turn in the items to the Freeport
> > Bartender one at a time as giving all 4 at once sometimes doesn't result
> in
> > anything. I also was given conflicting advice that if you cast Alliance
> on
> > him from the "patron" side of the bar that the Ogre will(not) attack
> you.
> >
> > Can anyone confirm/ deny either of these?
> > Thanks.
> >
> > --
> > Bahir
> >
> >
>
>
